verses.verse: Woe <S%H1945><s%> to you that spoil, <S%H7703><s%> and you were not spoiled; <S%H7703><s%> and deal treacherously, <S%H898><s%> and they dealt not treacherously <S%H898><s%> with you! when you shall cease <S%H8552><s%> to spoil, <S%H7703><s%> you shall be spoiled; <S%H7703><s%> and when you shall make an end <S%H5239><s%> to deal treacherously, <S%H898><s%> they shall deal treacherously <S%H898><s%> with you.

O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to us; we have waited <S%H6960><s%> for you: be you their arm <S%H2220><s%> every morning, <S%H1242><s%> our salvation <S%H3444><s%> also <S%H637><s%> in the time <S%H6256><s%> of trouble. <S%H6869><s%>
At the noise <S%H6963><s%> of the tumult <S%H1995><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> fled; <S%H5074><s%> at the lifting <S%H7427><s%> up of yourself the nations <S%H1471><s%> were scattered. <S%H5310><s%>

And your spoil <S%H7998><s%> shall be gathered <S%H622><s%> like the gathering <S%H625><s%> of the caterpillar: <S%H2625><s%> as the running <S%H4944><s%> to and fro of locusts <S%H1357><s%> shall he run <S%H8264><s%> on them.

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is exalted; <S%H7682><s%> for he dwells <S%H7931><s%> on high: <S%H4791><s%> he has filled <S%H4390><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%> with judgment <S%H4941><s%> and righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>

And wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and knowledge <S%H1847><s%> shall be the stability <S%H530><s%> of your times, <S%H6256><s%> and strength <S%H2633><s%> of salvation: <S%H3444><s%> the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is his treasure. <S%H214><s%>

Behold, <S%H2005><s%> their valiant <S%H691><s%> ones shall cry <S%H6817><s%> without: <S%H2351><s%> the ambassadors <S%H4397><s%> of peace <S%H7965><s%> shall weep <S%H1058><s%> bitterly. <S%H4751><s%>

The highways <S%H4546><s%> lie waste, <S%H8074><s%> the wayfaring <S%H5674><s%> <S%H734><s%> man ceases: <S%H7673><s%> he has broken <S%H6565><s%> the covenant, <S%H1285><s%> he has despised <S%H3988><s%> the cities, <S%H5892><s%> he regards <S%H2803><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> man. <S%H582><s%>

The earth <S%H776><s%> mourns <S%H56><s%> and languishes: <S%H535><s%> Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> is ashamed <S%H2659><s%> and hewn <S%H7060><s%> down: Sharon <S%H8289><s%> is like a wilderness; <S%H6160><s%> and Bashan <S%H1316><s%> and Carmel <S%H3760><s%> shake <S%H5287><s%> off their fruits.
Now <S%H6258><s%> will I rise, <S%H6965><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> will I be exalted; <S%H7311><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> will I lift <S%H5375><s%> up myself.

You shall conceive <S%H2029><s%> chaff, <S%H2842><s%> you shall bring <S%H3205><s%> forth <S%H3205><s%> stubble: <S%H7179><s%> your breath, <S%H7307><s%> as fire, <S%H784><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> you.
And the people <S%H5971><s%> shall be as the burnings <S%H4955><s%> of lime: <S%H7875><s%> as thorns <S%H6975><s%> cut <S%H3683><s%> up shall they be burned <S%H3341><s%> in the fire. <S%H784><s%>
Hear, <S%H8085><s%> you that are far <S%H7350><s%> off, what <S%H834><s%> I have done; <S%H6213><s%> and, you that are near, <S%H7138><s%> acknowledge <S%H3045><s%> my might. <S%H1369><s%>

The sinners <S%H2400><s%> in Zion <S%H6726><s%> are afraid; <S%H6342><s%> fearfulness <S%H7461><s%> has surprised <S%H270><s%> the hypocrites. <S%H120><s%> <S%H2611><s%> Who <S%H4310><s%> among us shall dwell <S%H1481><s%> with the devouring <S%H398><s%> fire? <S%H784><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> among us shall dwell <S%H1481><s%> with everlasting <S%H5769><s%> burnings? <S%H4168><s%>

He that walks <S%H1980><s%> righteously, <S%H6666><s%> and speaks <S%H1696><s%> uprightly; <S%H4339><s%> he that despises <S%H3988><s%> the gain <S%H1214><s%> of oppressions, <S%H4642><s%> that shakes <S%H5287><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> from holding <S%H8551><s%> of bribes, <S%H7810><s%> that stops <S%H331><s%> his ears <S%H241><s%> from hearing <S%H8085><s%> of blood, <S%H1818><s%> and shuts <S%H6105><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%> from seeing <S%H7200><s%> evil; <S%H7451><s%>

He shall dwell <S%H7931><s%> on high: <S%H4791><s%> his place of defense <S%H4869><s%> shall be the munitions <S%H4679><s%> of rocks: <S%H5553><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> shall be given <S%H5414><s%> him; his waters <S%H4325><s%> shall be sure. <S%H539><s%>

Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H2372><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> in his beauty: <S%H3308><s%> they shall behold <S%H7200><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> that is very <S%H4801><s%> far <S%H4801><s%> off.

Your heart <S%H3820><s%> shall meditate <S%H1897><s%> terror. <S%H367><s%> Where <S%H346><s%> is the scribe? <S%H5608><s%> where <S%H346><s%> is the receiver? <S%H8254><s%> where <S%H346><s%> is he that counted <S%H5608><s%> the towers? <S%H4026><s%>

You shall not see <S%H7200><s%> a fierce <S%H3267><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> a people <S%H5971><s%> of a deeper <S%H6012><s%> speech <S%H8193><s%> than you can perceive; <S%H8085><s%> of a stammering <S%H3932><s%> tongue, <S%H3956><s%> that you can not understand. <S%H998><s%>

Look <S%H2372><s%> on Zion, <S%H6726><s%> the city <S%H7151><s%> of our solemnities: <S%H4150><s%> your eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> a quiet <S%H7600><s%> habitation, <S%H5116><s%> a tabernacle <S%H168><s%> that shall not be taken <S%H6813><s%> down; not one of the stakes <S%H3489><s%> thereof shall ever <S%H5331><s%> be removed, <S%H5265><s%> neither <S%H1077><s%> shall any <S%H3605><s%> of the cords <S%H2256><s%> thereof be broken. <S%H5423><s%>

But there <S%H8033><s%> the glorious <S%H117><s%> LORD <S%H3068><s%> will be to us a place <S%H4725><s%> of broad <S%H7338><s%> <S%H3027><s%> rivers <S%H5103><s%> and streams; <S%H2975><s%> wherein shall go <S%H3212><s%> no <S%H1077><s%> galley <S%H590><s%> with oars, <S%H7885><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall gallant <S%H117><s%> ship <S%H6716><s%> pass <S%H5674><s%> thereby.
For the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is our judge, <S%H8199><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is our lawgiver, <S%H2710><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is our king; <S%H4428><s%> he will save <S%H3467><s%> us.

Your tacklings <S%H2256><s%> are loosed; <S%H5203><s%> they could not well <S%H3651><s%> strengthen <S%H2388><s%> their mast, <S%H8650><s%> they could not spread <S%H6566><s%> the sail: <S%H5251><s%> then <S%H227><s%> is the prey <S%H5706><s%> of a great <S%H4766><s%> spoil <S%H7998><s%> divided; <S%H2505><s%> the lame <S%H6455><s%> take <S%H962><s%> the prey. <S%H957><s%>

And the inhabitant <S%H7934><s%> shall not say, <S%H559><s%> I am sick: <S%H2470><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein shall be forgiven <S%H5375><s%> their iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>
